body.name: Crucial X9 Pro 1TB Portable SSD - Up to 1050MB/s Read and Write - Water and dust Resistant, PC and Mac, with Mylio Photos+ Offer - USB 3.2 External Solid State Drive - CT1000X9PROSSD902
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 16 hrs 29 mins
features: Powerful performance: With read and write speeds up to 1,050MB/s, the Crucial X9 Pro Portable SSD is powerful enough for editing directly from the drive and has high sustained performance of 975MB/s writes throughout the drive's capacity.

Broad compatibility: The X9 Pro offers plug-and-play compatibility with Windows, Mac, Android, iPad, PC, Linux, PlayStation and Xbox gaming consoles via an included USB-C cable. USB-C to USB-A adapter available separately for USB-A devices

Dust and splash proof durability: With IP55 water and dust resistance and drop-proof durability up to 7.5 feet/2 meters, your X9 Pro Portable SSD is durable enough to travel anywhere you shoot, work or roam.
Security that travels with you: Protect sensitive data in the studio, in the field, or while traveling with password protection and 256-bit AES hardware encryption.

Professional quality: Engineered by Micron, the Crucial X9 Pro Portable SSD comes in anodized aluminum with a rubberized soft-touch base in a mini 65 x 50 mm design that includes a drive activity light in the integrated lanyard hole.
body.description: Accelerate your workflow with the powerful performance of the Crucial X9 Pro Portable SSD. With space to store thousands of photos, files, and videos and the speed to edit and retouch your portfolio quickly, the Crucial X9 Pro provides support for even taxing workloads along with durability and style in the studio, in the field, or wherever you roam.

productInformation.value: 4.5 4.5 out of 5 stars 1,257 ratings 4.5 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: MB/s speed measured as maximum sequential performance of device as measured by Crucial on a high-performance desktop computer with Crystal Disk Mark (version 8.0.1 for x64). Your performance may vary.Some of the storage capacity is used for formatting and other purposes and is not available for data storage. 1GB equals 1 billion bytes.Best speeds available with USB Type-C to C cable on USB 3.2 Gen2 supported devices. Use USB Type-A adapter for older devices.Compatibility may vary and may be contingent on device formatting and host capabilities. Compatible Android devices must be able to work with USB Mass Storage over OTG. Operating system updates and reformatting may be required.Protection against dust and water projected in jets against the enclosure from any direction. The X9 Pro should not be submerged in water.Ships in exFAT format. Can be reformatted into NTFS, APFS, HFS, HFS+J or other formats. Reformatting will result in loss of data from the drive.N/AWorks with Bitlocker To Go on Windows and FileVault on macOS. Crucial Portable SSD Utility application for Windows and macOS launching September 2023.Up to 7.5 ft/2 meters without impact to data on a carpeted floor.One-month complimentary Adobe Creative Cloud personal All Apps plan available with eligible Crucial SSD purchase. Adobe Creative Cloud ID and Crucial product registration required for redemption. Eligible Crucial X9 Pro SSDs: CT4000X9PROSSD902, CT2000X9PROSSD902, CT1000X9PROSSD902 must be purchased between July 25, 2023 and December 31, 2024. Offer limited to one redemption per eligible Crucial SSD purchase and registration; up to two per Adobe Creative Cloud user account, subject to acceptance of applicable Terms of Use, while activation code supplies last. Additional terms and conditions may apply. Micron Technology reserves the right to change or discontinue this offer at any time without notice.Three-month complimentary Mylio Photo+ subscription available with eligible Crucial SSD purchase. Mylio Photo+ and Crucial product registration required for redemption. Eligible Crucial X9 Pro SSDs: CT4000X9PROSSD902, CT2000X9PROSSD902, CT1000X9PROSSD902 must be purchased by December 31, 2024. Only new accounts are eligible. Subject to acceptance of applicable Terms of Use, while redemption code supplies last. Additional terms and conditions may apply. Micron Technology reserves the right to change or discontinue this offer at any time without notice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Compact, portable, loseable, lol
reviews.reviewText: This thing is so compact it can probably fit into a card slot in my wallet, yet it holds 4tb of data in solid state with near instant access!The read and write speed says "up to" 1000+ mb, but after transferring roughly 3tb of data from my MSI gaming rig to this drive, I never achieved greater than ~600mb transfer speeds using my USB 3.2 type-C port and the cable that comes in the package with the drive.Speaking of cables, the cable that comes with the drive is only a few inches long, although it did manage to transfer data to this drive faster than my 6ft high speed data cable I use for charging my phone and tablet did. It would be nice to receive at least a couple of feet of data cable with this drive, however, given it's compact size, such a lengthy cable might increase the risk of misplacing this little thing.So far, I have not experienced any data corruption or loss, despite pausing a transfer and swapping out data cables before resuming, despite testing for shock damage during load/transfer, and despite having dropped the drive 3 times back-to-back from exactly 6ft 2in above the hardwood floor when not in use. The price is pretty competitive for the 4tb model that I got, and given the apparent durability, reliability and portability of this drive, I'd say it was worth every penny.I can actually see myself walking around with a pocket full of these things, one day.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I am completely satisfied with this portable SSD hard drive unit. In recent years, I have been using a Samsung brand unit, the T1 model, and it has worked very well, but I have noticed that the Crucial one is smaller, more compact, and faster! Totally recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tiny and Fast SDD
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace a couple of SanDisk SDDs that evidently have been failing a lot. I read several reviews on line about the Crucial drives and bought the 2TB version. The first thing you notice is this is tiny. See my picture. The Amazon pic makes it look larger than it is. It's not much bigger than a matchbook. It's well made, sturdy feeling, and has a metal top with rubberized bottom. It also has a lanyard hole in one corner. The cable is a USB C at both ends. That same cable, to support the high data rates, is pretty thick and stiff. But it's short so not an issue for me. My guess is you could use a quality Anker high throughput cable and get more flexibility. Minor issue. Data rate seems to be very good. Slightly slower in download than upload, but might be my imagination. I don't have a reliable way to measure speed, but one of my benchmarks is backing up very large raw photo files. It is indeed speedy. Great product if a bit pricey - but any good high capacity SDD is. I'm using it on a MacBook Air and MacBook Pro with zero compatibility issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A very good value and solid performance and reliability to date
reviews.reviewText: This drive is mainly used for file exchange between systems- one TB capacity, and transfer speeds up to 1GB per second. Small and compact, easy for travel, and no apparent issues with thermal throttling with high speed large file transfers- the package design with a metal case (good thermals) is probably a factor in that.The pricing is very attractive for the quality of construction and performance delivered- that was a factor in selecting this drive. The value proposition is very good, in my opinion. I expect to get more of these to use with dedicated test systems in my home lab.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: 2TB version review - no temperature, health, or other common SMART info available in HD Sentinel 6.1 Pro (GPT or MBR). In Crystal Disk Info 8.12, no smart data is available if GPT is used, but disk health and temp data shows up if MBR is used.Disk comes formatted in xFAT, but reformatted to NTFS with no issues. Decent data transfer (400+ MBps data transfer rate in Crystal Disk Mark 8.01, USB-C 3.1 port, T470 Lenovo, win 10 pro / I7 / 16GB ram).No adapter included from USB C to USB A (as expected per description), and the included USB C to USB C cable is very thick and rigid. Included cable is almost as big as half the drive.Very nice form factor, and decent data transfer speed, but with SMART compatibility issues I have to knock off one star.Micron CT2000X9PROSSD9 per DiskGenius, Win 10 is seeing this as a SCSI device.Latest Beta of HD Sentinel (6.10.5d) added support for this SSD. None of the NVMe features are supported (one less "*" rating) but general health and temp are now showing up correctly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great for Mac Mini timemachine and also editing videos on iPad iMovie app
reviews.reviewText: this drive Works terrific I love it I've been using it for a month or two initially for backups on my Mac Mini and it works very well for that but there's plenty of space and so I used it on vacation to work with some videos that I've taken off of my iPhone and iPad and the cool thing that I learned while doing all of that is that you can pretty easily transfer files onto this drive or even work with files while it's on this drive from a newer iPad I think I've got an iPad 11 in case that matters so I was actually working with videos where I needed to do some quick kind of holiday editing type stuff in iMovie and the files were on this drive and I was able to pull them into my iPad and it just showed up like another iPad ‘Files’ Drive. I will say that it didn't play those files from the drive easily but I could edit work with those files from the drive when it came to trying to play a file from it things got a little weird and I'm not totally sure if that's because I recorded something on one device and put it on the drive and then it was trying to edit it on the iPad or what but it definitely was able to work with those via iMovie and that was super super handy and helped me not have to break out a laptop

I recently purchased the Crucial X9 Pro 2TB Portable SSD, and I am absolutely thrilled with its performance! The speed it delivers with up to 1050MB/s read and write is nothing short of impressive. Transferring large files or running applications from this SSD is a breeze, and it has significantly improved my productivity.The compact and portable design is another standout feature. It's incredibly convenient to carry around, making it perfect for on-the-go professionals like me. The build quality feels sturdy and durable, ensuring that my data is safe even when I'm traveling.Setting it up was a breeze, and it seamlessly connects to my devices. The fact that it's compatible with both Windows and Mac is a huge plus. I appreciate the versatility it offers.Overall, the Crucial X9 Pro 2TB Portable SSD has exceeded my expectations in terms of speed, portability, and reliability. It's a fantastic addition to my tech arsenal, and I highly recommend it to anyone in need of fast and reliable storage for their work or personal needs.
Utilizzato per registrare in prores su iPhone, ssd compatto e molto solido.

Die Crucial X9 Pro 1TB Externe SSD hat meine Erwartungen übertroffen und sich als unschätzbarer Begleiter für meine Daten erwiesen. Die Geschwindigkeit, mit der sie liest und schreibt, ist schlichtweg beeindruckend und hat meine Arbeitsabläufe erheblich beschleunigt.Mit Lesegeschwindigkeiten von bis zu 1050MB/s bietet diese SSD eine nahezu sofortige Datenübertragung. Das hat nicht nur die Ladezeiten meiner Anwendungen reduziert, sondern auch die Übertragung großer Dateien zu einer flüssigen und effizienten Aufgabe gemacht. Die Schreibgeschwindigkeiten sind genauso beeindruckend und tragen dazu bei, dass meine Arbeitsprozesse reibungslos verlaufen.Das kompakte und robuste Design der X9 Pro macht sie zu einem idealen Begleiter für unterwegs. Die strapazierfähige Hülle schützt die Festplatte zuverlässig vor Stößen und Erschütterungen, und die kompakte Größe passt mühelos in meine Tasche. Die Tatsache, dass keine externe Stromquelle erforderlich ist, macht sie noch handlicher und bequemer im Gebrauch.Die Einrichtung war denkbar einfach, und die SSD ist sowohl mit Windows als auch mit Mac kompatibel. Der mitgelieferte USB-C-Anschluss gewährleistet eine schnelle und zuverlässige Verbindung zu meinen Geräten.Alles in allem bin ich mehr als zufrieden mit der Crucial X9 Pro 1TB Externe SSD. Sie hat meine Erwartungen in Bezug auf Leistung und Zuverlässigkeit übertroffen und ist zu einem unverzichtbaren Teil meiner digitalen Arbeitsumgebung geworden. Sehr empfehlenswert für alle, die nach einer leistungsstarken und tragbaren externen Festplatte suchen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Highly recommended for filmmakers. The T10 is even faster (if you need that).
